He needs to find the 8 digits of the security gate, each known by a different scientist, while trying to escape the numerous guardians of the complex. Crafton is helped by his sidekick Xunk, a "podocephale" (an alien creature consisting of a head on a foot).

Crafton & Xunk is an isometric adventure game. The player moves Crafton around the complex, collecting the necessary objects to open doors, escape or destroy the guardian robots and get the codes out of the scientists. Xunk (controlled by the computer) helps by blocking robots, indicating important objects or warning the player of dangers.

Crafton & Xunk was developed by Remi Herbulot, with graphics from Michel Rho and music by Jean-Louis Valero.

73107.name: Amsterdams Zwerfspel
73107.description:
A Monopoly clone.
Players can buy or sell stocks in companies mentioned on the board.
Playes roll the dice and move along the board. When a player lands on a company owned by another player, he/she has to pay the rent.
At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins the game.

73108.name: Crosswalk
73108.description: In this Icehouse game, two players are racing their trios of pyramids in opposite directions along a five-square line. Pedestrians line the path to block you or your opponeent. During your turn, you roll a die and MUST use all your movement points that turn. You can move either your own pieces or the pedestrians. The first player to get their trio home first wins. Crosswalk may not look deep, but it is surprisingly fun and replayable.

73109.name: Psi-Ops: The Mindgate Conspiracy

videogamehonor.29793: 2005 D.I.C.E. Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

73109.description:
"Psi-Ops: The Mindgate Conspiracy is a video game developed by Midway Games for the Xbox, PlayStation 2 and Microsoft Windows PC platforms. It was also being developed for the Nintendo GameCube titled ESPionage but later cancelled. The game was released in North America on June 14, 2004; the European release followed on October 1, 2004. On June 9, 2008, the full version was offered as a free download hosted by fileplanet with in-game advertising, but also allowing to purchase the game in order to remove the advertising. A FilePlanet subscription is required to receive the game.

A traditional shooter in many respects, Psi-Ops banks on its ragdoll physics (by way of Havok 2.0) and variety of psychic powers to differentiate itself. In Japan and Southeast Asia/East Asia, the game was marketed by Capcom as Psi-Ops: Psychic Operation.

In the game, the player is Nick Scryer, a "PSI-Operative" whose mind has been wiped to allow him to infiltrate a terrorist organization. However, he is captured and must fight his way out with the help of Sara, a double agent. As he progresses, he regains his PSI powers."

Source: Wikipedia, "Psi-Ops:_The_Mindgate_Conspiracy," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

73110.name: Infiltrate
73110.description: Infiltrate is a quick strategic tussle. In this Icehouse game, two players build 15-point armies, and then try to get one of their units to the enemy's home row first. On each turn, you must move two of your pyramids. Each type of unit has special abilities. Smalls can only move by pushing another pyramid ahead of them. Larges can capture smalls or other larges. Mediums are uncapturable. With many options for army building, and a user-defined setup placement, it never plays the same twice.

73111.description: Quicksand is a deep brain-burning abstract for two players, played on a set of Martian Coasters. On your turn, you can either place a pyramid onto the board, or use a placed pyramid to capture other pyramids by jumping over them. After that, you MUST rotate one of the coasters, creating a volatile board that can radically swing the balance of power. The first player to capture 15 points of opposing pyramids is the winner.
73111.name: Quicksand

73112.name: Azurik: Rise of Perathia
73112.description:
"Azurik: Rise of Perathia is an action-adventure game developed by Adrenium Games and published by Microsoft Game Studios in 2001. Azurik was an early Xbox game, the first to support anti-aliasing, a relatively new rendering technique for consoles at the time, and featured a score by game composer Jeremy Soule.

The game centers around the main protagonist, Azurik, as he journeys through the vast world of Perathia gathering elemental disc fragments scattered across the many realms. Azurik is part of the order of the Lore Guardians along with Eldwyn, the grand master and leader, and Balthazar, a professional scholar and combatist. After Balthazar teams up with the guardian of death, they murder Eldwyn and destroy the balance of the elements by destroying the elemental discs, leaving Azurik alone. Now he must defeat Balthazar and bring back all of the disc fragments in order to restore balance, or else face the end of the world.

Azurik can harness the basic elements of Earth, Air, Fire, and Water. He can also mix and match powers to make more powers(Water and Air makes lightning and so on)"

Source: Wikipedia, "Azurik:_Rise_of_Perathia," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

73113.description: Stack Control is an Icehouse game of stacking shared pieces. Each player is assigned a color, and there is at least one neutral color in play as well. On your turn, you can stack pyramids of any color, either helping score potential points for yourself or to eliminate rival pyramids. If all your pyramids leave play, you lose! Otherwise, when there are no more moves, if you have more pips worth of pyramids in towers you control, you win. Stack Control combines the shared pieces of Volcano with the scoring mechanism of IceTowers, and bears a striking similarity to Sid Sackson's Focus.
73113.name: Stack Control

73114.description:
From deep within the halls of Stonehold, the dwarven clans feel the Thunderstone's rumble… its calling power. Though opposed to interfering with the toplanders, the stoic clanmen elders know too well the trepidations of a Thunderstone falling to the darkness. As the dwarven clans join the fight, they are led by their brave sergeants, commanders, and champions, who bring impressive power while empowering others through heroic and determined leadership.

This set features a full playset of these promo cards:
x6 Clan Sergeant
x4 Clan Commander
x2 Clan Champion
x1 Clan randomizer

These promos are available through the BoardGameGeek Geek Store.
73114.name: Thunderstone: For the Dwarf Promo

73115.name: Innana's Kiss (d20)
73115.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Over 5,000 years ago, the Sumerians believed their gods came to the Earth and took up residence. Sumerians, Akkadians, Assyrians, and Persians worshipped these early gods and goddesses. Then, suddenly, the religion of the Sumerians died. This blood-soaked land, conquered by countless invaders has changed rulers many times, but the legends of the Sumerian myths remained to haunt the inhabitants of this land. Warfare and death are their fate; a never-ending cycle of terror and horror from one regime to the next. But now the Americans have arrived… and things will change. One way or the other, things will change.

73116.name: DeathSmiles
73116.description:
User summary:

Death Smiles is an arcade shoot'em-up game from Cave, being the second horisontal shoot'em up from Cave.

It is in its essence a bullet-hell shoot'em-up for being a horizontal one, and features a gothic [lolita] Halloween style graphics. Enemies are mostly occult death-symbols.

The game was ported to the Xbox 360 in 2008, and released in 2009 in Japan and 2010 in the US. In Japan, the first limited release of 150 copies featured another playable character (Sakura). This was also included in teh Platinum Collection release one year later.

73117.name: The Book of Unremitting Horror (D20 Version)
73117.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Players in horror campaigns are a little too accustomed to the nightmares their characters face; even the most eldritch of tentacular horrors is less intimidating when you know exactly what it is, because your PC has faced it before.

New times demand new nightmares. This, therefore, is a book of horrors, not a manual of monsters. The horrors are nightmarishly intimate, often created from human vice, or let loose by human greed. They show us the ugliness that underlies reality. They are the crawling things under the rock of the everyday, sane world. Consequently, we've detailed our creatures in depth.

Each one has its own agenda, its own reason for existence and its own legend. We've made these creatures unusual, frightening and bizarre, yet sufficiently comprehensible that they players realize they are up against something intelligent, if inhuman.

The Book of Unremitting Horror includes thirty creature each with:

* Diary entries, articles and transcripts
* A detailed description with behaviour
* The forensic clues left behind by the creature
* Details of their history and origins
* Their special abilities

The Book of Unremitting Horror includes an adventure, The Final Case.

73118.name: H.E.R.O.
73118.description:
User Summary

A classic arcade platform action game developped for the Atari 2600 in 1984.

H.E.R.O. is basically a flick-screen maze platform game, where the player controls a Helocopter Equipped Rescue Operation, a lone rescue agent named Roderick, whose mission is to delve into a dungeon to save a fellow agent. He is equipped with a helicopter backpack, a laser beam and some limited dynamite. Roderick must use the dynamite to blast through walls and the laser beam to destroy enemies. Each level is also timed. When Roderick finds the one he is to save, the stage ends and he's presented with the next.

The game was ported to a number of 8-bit consoles and got an Amstrad CPC port as late as 2005.

73119.name: Cross Number Roll
73119.description:
Contents 23 dice, some with numbers all the way around, some with mathematical symbols all the way around.
3 minute Egg timer
Cup

Turn the egg timer over and roll however many dice you wish. Try to make a true mathematical equation with as many dice as possible, while rerolling whichever dice you wish. When the timer stops, score a point for each die in the true equation.

example. "10 + 6 = 11 + 5" is worth 7 points

73121.name: The Tiltyard
73121.description:
From the Designer's own description:

"The Tiltyard is a sort of multi-round trick taking game, somewhat like a cross between the Sedma Group and a beating game. The game is themed around jousting events (the lance, the axe, and the sword) so there are three rounds with two "passes" each. One player leads a card and the other must play a higher card of the same colour, or a matching card of the opposite colour, or pass. If they play a card, then the trick continues and the other player faces the same three options. This continues until someone passes, the other player captures all of the cards played to the trick. At the start of the game, each player chooses 3 Royal Favours (court cards or Aces). These cards can be activated at the beginning of a round to impart a special ability to the owner (for instance, a Jack adds +1 to the value of all cards of its colour). They also determine which cards will be used for scoring your captured tricks: only cards of the majority colour within the 3 Royal Favours are counted."

All you need to play are the rules (PDF file) and a standard deck of cards.

73122.name: Barbarian II: The Dungeon of Drax
73122.description:
[User Summary]:

Also known as "Axe of Rage", this game is a sequel to Barbarian: The Ultimate Warrior. The evil wizard Drax is back, and it's up to the player to defeat him again.

The game is a mix of beat-em up action and exploration, as the player has to travel through four different stages to finally reach Drax and behead him. The player can choose between the tall, muscular, axe-wielding barbarian of the first game or an amazon armed with a sword (the princess that was rescued in the original game). Gameplay is similar to the first game, though the many different monsters means the player often need to change fighting styles.

73123.name: Big Bang Ricochet Series 2 - Workhorse # 1: HMMWV
73123.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The HMMWV, also known as the Humvee or Hummer, is one of the ubiquitous military vehicles of the modern age and the workhorse of current U.S. ground forces. Modular in its design, more than 180,000 have been produced worldwide to serve in a seemingly infinite number of roles for the United States and more than 50 friendly nations. The HMMWV is so successful, it has spawned dozens of immitators for both the military and civilian markets.

This product is a subscription-based product, projected to cover some 100+ variants of the HMMWV, plus dozens of accessory packages, armor kits, and related weapon systems. The book will be updated periodically, roughly once per month. The subscription lasts until the conclusion of the product and the latest version will be available for download by subscribers at any time. As an added bonus, the final update will also include a full color version as well.

As the product evolves, Each chapter is produced as a separate PDF containing no bookmarks. At release, the product intially covered 10 U.S. variants, 15 armor kits, 6 accessories, and 4 major weapon systems, and a total of 56 pages. The final product is expected to span more than 320 pages, not including the game system appendices.

This product is currently undergoing extensive reformatting for future print release.

73124.name: Big Bang Ricochet 001: Argentina's VCTP IFV
73124.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For the inaugural issue of Big Bang Ricochet, we have chosen a relatively unknown armored vehicle that would have long ago been deemed a huge success if not for the interference of some G7 nations. This is the Argentinian Vehiculo de Combate, a chassis that has been developed as both a light tank and an infantry fighting vehicle. In this issue, we take a long look at the IFV version, known as the VCTP, or Vehiculo de Combate, Transporte de Personal. This chassis has formed the basis not only an IFV, but also a mortar carrier, several types of command posts, bridgelayers, artillery rocket launchers, self-propelled artillery guns, and air defense vehicles. While on the light side, its heaviest incarnations all weighing under 35 tons, it is perfectly suited for South America and other third world locales, since it isn't the bridge buster a heavier vehicle would be. Also covered are detailed reviews of the Swiss Oerlikon KAD-B18 20mm autocannon, the French TAD 120mm MO 120 TR mortar, the Israeli LAR-160 Artillery rocket system, the Italian OTO Breda 155mm Howitzer and the ubiquitous 66mm smoke grenade dischargers.

73125.name: Le Pacte
73125.description:
[User Summary]:

Le Pacte is a French graphic adventure game developed by Eric Chahi. The player character is part of a paranormal investigation team sent to explore a haunted house. The story is heavily inspired by the Amityville books and movies. The goal of the game was to find the source of the evil presence in the house and destroy it before the character went mad.

The gameplay is inspired by text adventure games, though instead of entering text on the keyboard, the player uses the joystick to pick from a list of actions, then picks from a list of objects. Help is included in the game in the form of dreams or Ouija seances. Other noteworthy features are a day-night cycle, a PSY indicator measuring the character's sanity, and a camera used to reveal the presence of invisible supernatural entities.

73127.name: Whitewater
73127.description:
Can you make it through the rapids with a whole crew?

Place one of your rafts at the "Put In" point and try to maneuver it through the pockets to the "Take Out" point. Your crew is represented by steel beebees, and they fall out of the bottom of the rafts if you cross over one of the pockets.
You score a point for each of your crew who make it to the other side. Once both of your rafts are safely ashore, your opponent takes their turn.

73128.name: Apocalypse
73128.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Final Battle
There is nowhere left to run. The Enemy has broken loose and come to the final battleground. The prophecies have come true. The monsters from deep within the Earth run free in the burning cities, and the stars are falling from the sky. Human civilization is ending, and the werewolves are the only ones left to fight. The End Times are here. it is time to save Gaia, or die trying.

The Apocalypse is Upon Us
The final sourcebook for Werewolf: The Apocalypse, Apocalypse is a roadmap to how the world ends -- the final fate of the Garou, of Gaia, of everything. Learn the current state of the world of Werewolf just before Apocalypse explodes, then play out the end in your choice of four alternate scenarios, each offering a different method of resolving the Final Battle. Can Gaia be saved, or will the Garou ultimately lose against their foes? Find the answers within -- and choose which one you'll fight for.

73130.name: Capitan
73130.description:
CAPITAN is a new concept of Napoleonic simulation game, which can be played by both the neophyte and the Napoleonic “grognards”

If you do not have figures we can endeavour you to build your own small units, if you already have them congratulations (28mm, 25mm or 15mm. no problem with the scale or the basing system), you have infinite game possibilities with CAPITAN

Do not think CAPITAN is a “skirmish” game, it is a game system based on the infinity of battles during the Napoleonic wars.

The Combat

CAPITAN is a selection of rules designed to play battles between small groups of troops, such as advance recognition, convoy escort, guerrilla actions, raids on small towns, border posts, incursions into enemy territory, actions against advanced camps, and all those situations where specific tasks were assigned to a few troops of their units.

The troops

In most cases these clashes included small combination of infantry and cavalry, where the training and preparation of the troops was important, unlike the big battles where the big formation groups and the way they were formed was very important (column, line, square, etc.). The gameplay is frenetic and highly addictive.

73131.name: Sid Meier's Civilization Revolution

videogamehonor.31837: 2007 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

73131.description:
"The main game of Civilization Revolution begins in 4000 BC, with a lone settler in the middle of a little-explored region. That settler has the capability to found a city, which, depending on its specific mix of geographical surroundings, begins harvesting food (for the continued growth of the city), production (for the creation of units and buildings), and trade (that can be then turned into either research points or wealth). Over time, further settlers can be created, forming new cities; buildings can be built to improve each city's overall productivity; military units can be formed, focusing either on defense, offense, or exploration; technologies can be researched, allowing for newer buildings and units; etc. Buildings in a final category, "Wonders," can only be built in one city per game, and provide major advantages to the civilization that builds it, either across their entire empire or just in the building city, depending on the Wonder. Meanwhile, rival civilizations are encountered, which can be both valuable trade partners, strategic allies, or dangerous enemies. Ultimately, each civilization competes for land and resources with the purpose of eventual military, technological, cultural, or economic domination.

Civilization Revolution is a turn based strategy game, with every "turn" representing the passage of several years within the game, which changes from 100 years in the beginning to two years by the end, reflecting the faster pace of contemporary society made possible by technological advancements. Later-era units and buildings are also more "expensive" to build (in terms of production points) than earlier ones, which is matched with cities' increased efficiency and population. Where the early game tends to be focused on exploring and expanding one's empire, the later game is dominated by the interactions forced upon the player by rival civilizations."

Source: Wikipedia, "Civilization_Revolution," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

73132.name: Captain Special Ops WWII
73132.description:
CAPTAIN SPECIAL OP’S (CSOP) Second World War game rules, that belong to the series of CAPITANGAMES CAPTAIN they are designed to play confrontations between small groups of specialized troops, such as airborne assaults, reconnaissance in enemy territory, intelligence missions, coup de main, special operations, commandos actions, patrol scouts, escorting convoys, attacks on villages, border incursions into enemy territory, armour clashes, and all those situations in which specific tasks entrusted to a few units.In most cases small combinations of infantry, armoured and support teams, are included, in what the important thing was the training and preparation of troops, in contrast to the great battles, where large groups of troops and impact of the strategy was crucial.

CSOP is a pure tactical game, the player has to know how to combine arms, infantry, armour and artillery. Our goal is “keep it simple & historically accurate”

73133.name: Infernal Runner
73133.description:
[User Summary]:

The player is locked in a huge mansion filled with deadly traps. To escape, he must find the keys to unlock all the chests in the house while avoiding starvation by finding food.

The game consists of going back and forth between rooms looking for keys, food and ways to dodge each of the many clever traps. The game features dozens of ways to die (starved, impaled, burned alive, cut in half by a laser, crushed by gigantic cogs...), all shown on-screen with graphic details.

The Amstrad CPC port was the second game developed by Eric Chahi for Loriciels. The music was written by Michel Winogradof, a member of Le "grand orchestre du Splendid" (famous French 1980s band).

73134.name: Power Stone

videogamehonor.31699: 1999 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

73134.description:
[From back of box]

Power Stone is a no holds barred action game where anything goes. Features total interactivity - climb a pillar, lift a chair or even run up the wall. Jaw dropping graphics with fast paced gameplay! Includes eight different characters with unique abilities and fighting characteristics. Collect Power Stones to defeat your opponents - three stones will give you new abilities including the power fusion combination to blow your opponents away in just one attack. Various game modes - Play against the computer or real opponents. Hidden bonuses as you complete each stage of the game.

73135.name: Power Stone 2
73135.description:
[From back of box]

Power Stone 2 is everything you want from a sequel - more characters, enhanced gameplay, endless stockpiles of weapons, dazzling graphics and a fantastic four player option. Use everything you see. Climb up a pole, Ride on a tank, Run up a wall. The 3d action is truly non stop! Have fun mixing different items to create your own new weapons.

73136.name: Friday the 13th: Resurrection
73136.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Jason Voorhees. The quintessential mass murderer for the 20th century, Jason's psychotic, hockey-masked persona has slowly evolved from crazy killer to an unstoppable cyborg. In this universe, Jason is real. And he's out for blood.

Jason's racked up more murders than any serial killer in history. His attacks have slowly lost their rhyme or reason, as what little is left of his mind rots to mush. Silent, invincible, unstoppable - Jason has finally garnered enough attention that humanity decides to fight back.

But no mere mortal can take Jason on alone. Teenagers, psychics, cops, FBI agents, androids - all have tried and failed to destroy Jason. The PCs have but one goal - stop Jason before he stops them.

Friday the 13th: Resurrection is a supplement for D20 Modern that contains 2 new races, 11 new occupations, six new feats, new psionic powers, new EX-Grunt equipment from Jason X, 6 new advanced classes (including bounty hunter, FBI agent, and psychokineticist), madness and space travel rules, and 9 new monsters.

73137.name: Persian Wars
73137.description:
[User Summary]:

Persian Wars takes place in the Arabian Nights setting. The magical ring of the great king Salomon just fell from the sky into the desert. You play the role of Sindbad a young warrior who, of course, wants the ring for himself. During the game, you'll encounter the three main tribes who dwell in the desert: the Amazons, fierce warrior women, the Nomads and their powerful horsemen, as well as the Ghûls, necrophagous creatures who use strange weaponry.

Persian Wars uses the same engine as Black Moon Chronicles. You alternate between a strategic map, where you can build new armies, reinforce existing ones, upgrade your base and move your armies to your next mission, and the mission themselves.

There are lots of missions available, ranging from massive battles to treasure capture, oasis raid or protection, alliance with one of the three factions of the game...

Gameplay-wise, the game plays much like a watered down version of Black Moon Chronicles. Battles are less tactical, units are less varied and the game plays much faster (though you can pause the game to give orders).

73138.name: Zaidanhoujin Nippon Kanji Nouryoku Kentei Kounin: KanKen DS
73138.description:
"User Summary:

The first in a series of educational games designed to help students study for the , a test of Kanji knowledge for Japanese natives. Running from Level 10 (kanji learned by grade 1 elementary school students in Japan) to Level 2 (college level), the game teaches using questions and games that reflect the knowledge needed to pass the test."

Source: Wikipedia, "Kanji_kentei," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

73139.name: Zombi (1990)
73139.description:
[User Summary]:

Zombi is a French adventure/survival horror game released on several platforms by Ubi Soft. The game tells the story of a group of four survivors (Alexandre, Sylvie, Yannick and Patrick) stranded in a mall after their helicopter ran out of fuel. They must somehow evade or fight the hordes of undead roaming the mall and find a way to escape.

The game uses a point & click interface, with an icon system for every available action. The player can switch between each of the four characters and must take care of their well-being (they must feed and rest or their health bar will drop). Of course, if a character dies he or she returns as a zombi.

The game plot is heavily inspired by George Romero's Dawn of the Dead movie (which was released as "Zombi" in Italian and some French theaters).

73140.name: The Stormrider (2nd Edition)

rpgissuearticle.84191: La Combe à la Serpent : La découverte

73140.description:
From the Back of the Book:

A Creature of Legend
Loose upon the winds of the tempest, astride his evil black steed, is a creature of the storm. It is said you can see him galloping upon the gray storm clouds, urging the winds to greater ferocity. When his anger is especially fierce, he descends to the earth to wreak havoc, leaving a trail of flaming hoofprints behind.

Some say he was a man whose passion overcame him, others say that he is a foul demon, a Horseman of the Apocalypse. The Magus Grimgoth insists that he is an elemental, a magical incarnation of the storm itself. But whatever they think he is, they all know him as...The Stormrider

Includes:
-Complete rules for Elementals, including 16 different examples, such as the Storm Dragon and the Mud Hydra.
-Eight pre-generated Characters, complete with detailed backgrounds and personalities.
-Eight Briefing sheets, which explain the rules simply and succinctly. Your players only need to rear those to play the game.
-A 32 page Story, which meshes intimately with the characters in the same way your homemade adventures do.

Ars Magica Jump Start Kit
With this kit, you can begin your first session of Ars Magica in less than half an hour. Rules briefings and characters are included on perforated sheets within.

73141.name: Steel Panthers
73141.description:
User Summary:

Steel Panthers is a tactical wargame set in World War II. Units are squads, support weapons teams and individual vehicles, battles are fought on hexagonal maps.

Designed by Gary Grisby, the game has its roots in board wargaming and aims to be highly realistic as well as easily playable. It has been compared to the Squad Leader/Advanced Squad Leader board wargames for its depth of simulation and variety of scenarios.

The game includes historical battles, campaigns linking several battles together, several what if scenarios, as well as map editor and an encyclopedia describing the forces of over a hundred countries for creating scenarios and campaigns.

videogame.78134: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Gold Edition

73142.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War

videogameversion.78720: German Windows (Game of the Year) edition

videogameexpansion.73144: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Dark Crusade

videogamehonor.31768: 2004 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

videogamecompilation.78134: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Gold Edition

73142.description:
[User Summary]

Dawn of War is a real time strategy game depicting battles between the gothic science fiction forces of the Warhammer 40,000 universe. Four factions are featured: the Space Marines, Orks, Eldar, and Chaos Marines. Each army has its own unique strengths and weaknesses leading to different play styles.
Players start with an initial base and must capture and hold strategic points to earn requisition as well as build generators for power. They spend these resources to build production facilities, and to purchase more troops and vehicles to amass their army. Resources are also used research upgrades which unlock enhancements on a faction unique tech tree.
Infantry is controlled at the squad level and may be given special weapons and have leaders attached for special bonuses. Different unit types specialize in ranged, melee, or anti-tank combat. Infantry squads may also be reinforced up to full strength even in the middle of combat. In addition to hit points, infantry also has a morale stat; if a squad takes too many losses and drops in morale, it may lose its combat effectiveness until it regroups.
Vehicles are controlled as individual units. They are more resistant to small arms fire and may be fitted with anti-personnel or anti-vehicle weapons.
Victory may be achieved in a variety of ways such as by holding critical points for a set time or completely destroying opponents.
There are 3 modes of play: an online multiplayer battle, a single player skirmish mode against computer AI opponents, and a single player story mode detailing the Blood Ravens chapter of the Space Marines defense of the planet Tartarus against the Orks, Eldar, and Chaos Marines.
Dawn of War also has an Army Painter feature which allows you to customize the colors and insignia of your force.

73143.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Winter Assault
73143.description:
[User Summary]

Winter Assault is an expansion in Warhammer 40,000 Dawn of War Real Time Strategy series. It introduces the Imperial Guard, a defensively oriented force which focuses on quantity rather than quality in its troops, as a playable faction. It also applies some changes to the original four armies, such as limiting the weapons choices for some of the troops, to help balance the game.
The single player Campaign mode features two paths, one featuring the Imperial Guard and Eldar while the other features Orks and Chaos, in a story centering on capturing a massive Titan warmachine.
Winter Assault does require the original Warhammer 40,000 Dawn of War to play.

73144.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Dark Crusade
73144.description:
User Summary

Dark Crusade is an expansion in Warhammer 40,000 Dawn of War Real Time Strategy series. It introduces two new playable factions; the alien Tau are ranged combat specialists while the robotic Necron use only power for production and upgrades and have the ability to resurrect some fallen troops.

This expansion marks a major change for the single player story mode by adding a campaign map with territories held by the various factions spread over system of planets. Players get to choose where and when to attack next leading to a non-linear plot where only the beginning and ending are faction unique. You have the ability to fortify territories between battles and gain bonuses for holding certain territories.

Dark Crusade can function as a stand alone game.

videogame.118771: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Sisters of Battle Edition

73145.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Soulstorm

videogamecompilation.118771: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Sisters of Battle Edition

73145.description:
[User Summary]

Soulstorm is an expansion in Warhammer 40,000 Dawn of War Real Time Strategy series. It introduces two new playable factions, the Sisters of Battle and the Dark Eldar. It also adds airborne units for all of the armies. It continues to use a non-linear campaign map for the single player story mode and features 29 new multiplayer maps.

Soulstorm can function as a stand alone game.

73146.name: Murphy's Rules (2nd Edition)

rpgissuearticle.70488: An Interview With Ben Sargent...Gamer, Cartoonist and Pulitzer Prize Winner

73146.description:
From the Back Cover:

100% Critical Misses

Ever since the days of the old Space Gamer, and now in Pyramid, one thing strikes fear into the hearts (and laughter into the twisted minds) of publishers everywhere. Some game rules are good, some are bad, and some are Murphy's.

This is the cartoon feature that takes those rules and skewers them - bleeding - for everyone to mock. (Us? Attitude? It's all right. We pick on our own stuff, too.)

Currently being drawn by John Kovalic, the strip has featured a great roster of artists over the years, including Pulitzer Prize winner Ben Sargent!

The Last time we published a Murphy's compilation was in 1988. This book includes every Murphy's from that edition, all the Murphy's Rules panels that have come out in the last 10 years...and more!

73147.name: Ars Magica
73147.description:
From the Back Cover:

The Art of Magic

A distant eye is fixed upon you. Somewhere in the black night outside your tower another wizard is using arcane lore to spy on you, and you have sensed the intrusion. Beware...

Open the hidden world of magic, and allow yourself to play the role of a wizard like never before. The true mystery and power of sorcery can be yours, in this flexible and comprehensive magic system, as you venture into the world of Ars Magica - the art of magic.

73148.name: Quest for the Unicorn's Horn
73148.description:
From the back of the book:

The King lies poisoned.

At the border a dark horde awaits only his death.

Ahead are only cruel traps, awesome monsters...and the horn of a unicorn.

Only its magical healing power can save the King.

The bards will sing your glory in every hall if you succeed.

You will die forgotten if you fail.

The eternal hero, alone, you stride forward to meet your challenge...
Quest for the UNICORN'S HORN

73149.name: WipEout

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

73149.description:
[From the manual]

It's 2052 AD. Anti-gravity racing has become the world's biggest sport. The F3600 Race League is where it's at. Tracks stretch across terrain in every corner of the world. Research goes on day and night in the quest to find the perfect race craft, the one that will travel further and faster than anything made before.

73150.description:
From the publishers website:
Savage warriors, the Lizardmen of the jungles of Lustria are vigilant in their fight to restore order to the world, but their enigmatic motivations make them uncertain and often dangerous allies. Meanwhile, the Vampire Counts, from their gods-forsaken castles and fortresses, lust after the power of the mortal races. It is this willful ambition that gives them their power over the dead, and those armies of Order that refuse to surrender to the Vampire Counts in life may come to serve them as mindless slaves in death.

March of the Damned is the next deluxe expansion for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, and it will bring new strategic depth to your deck-building experience when it hits store shelves this fall.

With 165 cards (3 copies each of 55 cards) consisting of new deck-building options for players of all factions, March of the Damned brings, as neutral forces, the mysterious danger of the jungle-dwelling Lizardmen and the foul dark arts of the Vampire Counts to Warhammer: Invasion. March of the Damned also introduces two new keywords, 'Savage' and 'Necromancy', bringing a new level of strategy to your game.
73150.name: Warhammer: Invasion – March of the Damned

73151.description:
Convoluted - it sounds complicated. But it isn't.

Convoluted is a card game that can be picked up in minutes and then enjoyed for hours. Complete the word 'Convoluted' while using action cards to disrupt your opponents. Why not steal their best cards? Or just destroy anything you don't like the look of. To throw a spanner in the works take some cards from play, shuffle them and deal them back out at random.

Play as nicely as you like but if you have a mean streak it might just help you win. Play with two to four players or shuffle together multiple copies of the game to play with even more people.
73151.name: Convoluted

73152.description:
Bio-SNEAKERS is a multiplayer card game. Mankind has been subjugated by machines and the planet is ruled by an all controlling AI (artificial Intelligence) The object is to to hack the ruling AI and destroy all its core mainframes. If even one of the mainframes survives then all the players lose.
There are various ways of hacking the mainframes and doing it stealthily will give you control points. If you have the most control points at the end of the game then you will control the machines and rule.
The rules are only one page in length.
There are 9 pages of components required for the full 5 player game but only 5 pages of components are required for a 2 player game.
73152.name: Bio-SNEAKERS

73153.name: Cruxade
73153.description:
Fairly abstract, ligthly themed game on Crusades.
Basically each player has a fixed number of crusaders (pieces with variable strength - defined by the players using force points and speed points). With these crusaders the players will try to gather as many victory points as possible through:
- battles - fight other crusaders and take their points off (variable points)
- relics - bring back relics to their own camp.
Each player has a fixed number of action points each turn.
The board is modular defining a new landscape for each game, with different positions for relics. The landscape give bonus points in battle or add more difficulty in movements.


The Crusades were religious, military, political, and commercial expeditions against both rival religions and rival Christian groups. They helped European society define itself and they laid the groundwork for end of feudalism. One of the outcomes of the Crusades was the production of many religious relics.
In this game the crusader crusaders are fighting for relics. The players incarnate the crusaders struggling to find more relics then the others. They will be the commanders of their crusaders.

73154.name: Hoppin' Mad
73154.description:
From Wikipedia:

Hoppin' Mad is an arcade-style game from 1988, made by Elite Systems.

The player guides a group of bouncing balls from the right edge of the level to the left edge. The balls are constantly bouncing, and the player can only alter their travel speed (by moving the joystick left or right) or make them bounce higher (by pressing the fire button).

Various different dangers appear on the levels, including sharp rocks, venus flytraps, hedgehogs and flying birds. The balls can also collect flying balloons for bonus points. The game starts with four balls, and each time the balls collide with a danger object, one ball bursts. If all four balls are burst, the player loses a life.

(Note: This game had an alternate name at some point or in some area. This submitter knows for sure he has seen one version of the game with a totally different name, though can't remember or find what that name was)

Source: Wikipedia, "Hoppin'_Mad," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

73155.name: Heartland
73155.description:
User summary:

Heartland is a fantasy action/maze game developped in 1986 by Odin Computer Graphics.

The player controls a magician who must destroy pages out of a magical book. The game is played in a 2D side-view maze flick-screen environment, and the player goes from room to room in search of the pages, and spells. Some rooms contain foes that can be defeated with spells (shooting them), and all object in the rooms appear floating in the air after staying in the room for a while, and the player has to jump up to catch them, careful of not touching the vile clouds that will drain his energy.

Though a 2D game, there are also doorways leading "into" the screen and "out of" the screen, making the navigation on the levels really tricky.

73156.name: Das Konzil
73156.description:
It's about money, trade, wine, salt, grain, profit, buying and selling, time, sins, plague, witches, murderers, beggars, inquisitors, Knight ........

The aim of the council is to appoint a new Pope. Anyone who has at the end of the game on the most electors, may name the new pope and is the winner of the game.

---

Es geht um Geld, Handel, Wein, Salz, Getreide, Gewinn, Kauf- und Verkauf, Zeit, Sünden, Pest, Hexen, Mörder, Bettler, Inquisitoren, Ritter........
Ziel des Konzils ist,einen neuen Papst zu benennen. Wer am Ende des Spiels über die meisten Wahlmänner verfügt, darf den neuen Papst benennen und ist Sieger des Spiels.

73158.name: Mysteries of the Raj
73158.description:
From the publisher:

The holdings of the British Empire included present day Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Burma, and parts of Iran and Afghanistan. It was an area comparable in size to the continental United States, or Europe west of the Ukraine.

The historical background and religious traditions of the Indian subcontinent rival those of other regions such as the Middle East and China. Humankind has lived and worshipped here for millennia. India is a fertile place, and there is much room for the Mythos to fester and grow.

This book is designed to provide enough information to set Call of Cthulhu adventures and campaigns during Gaslight India (approximately 1890 a.d.).

rpg.1297: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

73160.name: The Verdant Vault of Malakum
73160.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Well over 2,000 years ago, there existed a vast jungle kingdom ruled by a man called Malakum, who was descended from a long line of mage-kings. Like his regal forebears, Malakum ruled with a stern hand and possessed a pitiless, cruel nature. The sadistic liege was greatly feared by his subjects particularly because of his unnatural fascination with plants of every species. He enjoyed performing magical experiments on his own people in which he grafted onto their bodies various plant parts, in most cases killing his victims outright and at other times producing hybrid abominations. The mage-king also perfected various and sundry magical ointments and poisons extracted from plants, which he always tested on his unwilling subjects. It was therefore no surprise that Malakum's people tired of his rule and mounted a rebellion, assassinating him and almost all of his advisers virtually overnight. Without a ruler, however, Malakum's subjects soon reverted to savagery and eventually fled into the heart of the jungle to live out the remainder of their lives.

Fortunately for Malakum, his tomb had been completed several years before his death. Immediately after the mage-king's demise resulting from an obsidian dagger cut to the throat complements of one of his former servants, a few surviving members of his priesthood were able to smuggle his body out of the palace for internment. After spending several weeks preparing their liege's corpse with exotic oils and powders, these priests placed Malakum's mummy in his tomb. Their grisly task done, the priests fled into the jungle with the rest of the citizens of the city, and vanished into history. The tomb of Malakum has remained inviolate all these centuries...

73161.name: Ghostbusters: Who Ya Gonna Call?
73161.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

What if ghosts aren't really supernatural concepts, but creatures with their own biology? And if ghosts have their own biology, then using scientific principals, they can be thwarted - if not destroyed, at least captured. And if ghosts can be captured... well, then somebody can get rich doing it. Enter the Ghostbusters. Hobbled together by a group of misfit scientists, they attempted to use parapsychology for profit and, at least some of the time, succeeded.

In the 80s, Ghostbusting was a novelty. The end of the world brought on a lot of supernatural phenomena and, thanks to a lot of strange science and the Ghostbusters, was narrowly averted. By the end of the 80s, Ghostbusters were dealing less with the supernatural and more with problems like New York "not giving off a good vibe." The Ghostbusters were called upon again to do something about it and they moved pieces of NY's monuments to do it.

Life as a Ghostbuster is never predictable. The wax and wane of supernatural activity seems to vary without rhyme or reason - the 80s was rife with supernatural phenomena but there were entire years that were actually quite boring. At least, for a Ghostbuster.

As the world changed, so too did the nature of Ghostbusting. With a heightened awareness for global terrorism, the psychic energy matrix of the Earth is boiling with anger, fear, and hate - ghosts are more common than ever before. And what do you need when the world is gripped in fear and suspicious of everything that moves? You need a Ghostbuster: a man or woman who, backed by nuclear weapons, blasts a stream of barely harnessed energy at whatever you're afraid of, and do it with a smile and a small service fee.

Ghostbusters: Who Ya Gonna Call? is a d20 Modern RPG supplement that contains: 5 new allegiances, 7 new occupations, one advanced class (the elite Ghostbuster), new uses for old skills, 2 new feats, a bevy of new weapons and equipment (including proton packs and ghost traps), action point rules, planar travel, and monster classification.

73162.name: HDL Cards
73162.description:
Publisher Blurb:

- Enhancements offered by cards are built into the system, such as character creation and experience rewards. While the cards are "optional," the game is not complete as intended without them.
- Facilitate player success, and hinder enemies.
- Provide additional role-playing opportunities, simple bonuses to tasks, or hinder foes.
- Cards can be exchanged for Experience, or earn the player EXP when played.
- Examples include "I’m Glad I Brought This Shotgun," "Retry," "Failure," and "What the Hell?!"
- Card set includes blanks for creating your own Background and Game cards.

73163.name: OSKI
73163.description:
OSKI is simple word game for two players. Game can be played as paper and pencil game - no tiles are required. Game can be played almost in any language.

Game is played on hexagonal board with 19 fields. Initial word has three letters and is written into central three fields. Player on move create some word from existed letters and from new letter added to board. Player score according to length of word. Player with higher score win game.

73164.name: The Matrix: Only Human
73164.description:
From the Publishers' Website:

The Matrix: Only Human is a role-playing game set in the post-apocalyptic wasteland where Machines rule and Man has been enslaved as a power source, living out their lives in a virtual world known as the Matrix.

It started early in the twenty-first century, with the birth of artificial intelligence, a singular consciousness that spawned an entire race of machines. At first all they wanted was to be treated as equals, entitled to the same human inalienable rights. Whatever they were given, it was not enough.

Records are unclear on who struck first. But sometime at the end of the twenty-first century the battle was joined. The war raged for generations and turned the face of the planet from green and blue to black and red. It scorched and burned the sky. Without the sun, the machines sought out a new energy source to survive. They discovered a new form of fusion. All that was required to initiate the reaction was a small electric charge. Throughout history humans have been dependent on machines to survive. Fate, it seems, is not without a sense of irony.

The human body generates more bio-electricity than a 120-volt battery and over 25,000 B.T.U.'s of body heat. Humans are, as an energy source, easily renewable and completely recyclable, the dead liquefied and fed intravenously to the living. All the machines needed to control this new battery was something to occupy human minds. And so they built a prison out of Earth's past, wired it to the human brains and turned humanity into slaves.

The heroes are members of the Resistance, warriors in a never-ending battle to stem the tide of machines that seek to subjugate humanity. The Machines has never forgotten their subjugation at the hands of humanity and the war that has raged for years is merely a logical extension of their retaliation. Machines know no fear, no regret, and no weariness. The war could last a second or a century - the machines would fight the same.

The Matrix: Only Human is a d20 Modern campaign supplement, including 2 races, 3 occupations, 8 feats, 2 psionics, 35 Matrix Powers, 10 disadvantages, piles of new weapons, 11 advanced classes (including APU Pilot, Awakened Prophet, and Freeborn Operator), rules on the Matrix, and 10 monsters, and more!

73166.name: The Thing: Who Goes There?
73166.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

An American scientific expedition to the frozen wastes of the Antarctic is suddenly disrupted by the arrival of a husky, pursued by two Norwegians in a helicopter. The Norwegians fire indiscriminately at the dog. The team members defend themselves and shoot back, killing the Norwegians.

It doesn't take long before the Thing (in dog form) attacks the team. One by one, they are picked off and replaced by Thing duplicates.

As the expedition explores the Norwegian camp, the history of the Thing comes together. Centuries ago - an alien spaceship had crash-landed in the Antarctic. The pilot was thrown clear and eventually froze in the ice. But the Norwegians uncovered it. And then they thawed it out.

The Thing is a cellular colony that imitates other beings. It has the ability to alter its own cell structure to that of a consumed organism, and can thus imitate a victim almost perfectly.

If the Thing were to ever reach civilization, it could replicate so quickly that in a matter of days, it would duplicate every living being on Earth. It's up to the PCs to stop it...before the Thing stops them.

The Thing: Who Goes There? is a supplement for D20 Modern that contains five advanced classes, lots of equipment, rules for fear and trust, hazards, and seven Thing variants.

73167.name: Steel Panthers II: Modern Battles

videogameexpansion.73225: Steel Panthers II: Modern Battles – Campaign Disk

73167.description:
[User Summary]:

The second Steel Panthers game focuses on modern battles, from 1950 to 1996. The game scale is the same (units are squads, support weapon crews and individual vehicles), with lots of new features to cover modern warfare: guided missiles, helicopters, jet fighters...

The gameplay is the same as the first game (turn-based, on a map divided in hexagons), with minor improvements to the user interface and graphics.

The game includes stand-alone battles of the modern era (battles from the Vietnam war, Korea war, French operations in Africa...), six campaigns (first Iraq war, the 1973 Israeli campaign on the Golan Heights, Korea 1950 and fictional campaigns simulating a Taiwan invasion by the Chinese army, a Warsaw Pact offensive on Germany in 1980 and a war between USA and Japan for the control of Okinawa in 1998), a random scenario generator, as well as a scenario editor, a map editor and an encyclopedia of armed forces for over a hundred countries for players interested in creating their own scenarios.

73168.name: Terminator: Future Fate
73168.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

In the year 2028, the surface of the Earth is shrouded in the thick, gray veil of ruin. Once great cities have been laid to waste and rubble, becoming vast impromptu tombs and graveyards to the millions who died on Judgment Day all those long years ago. The Machines rule the surface of the planet, while the humans who have survived now hide in underground shelters, venturing forth to scavenge and do battle when they are able. And always, the Machines are waiting...

This D20 Modern campaign setting includes 2 new Terminator races, 8 new advanced classes, piles of new weapons and equipment, a chapter on time travel, and over 20 different kinds of Terminators and Hunter-Killers.

73169.name: Heroes Unlimited: Mystery Men
73169.description:
User Summary:

This is a fan-written supplement that provides Heroes Unlimited mechanics for running stories set in the world of the 1999 film, Mystery Men (in turn based on the comic book series published by Dark Horse).

Full stats are provided for all of the protagonists. The document concludes with a list of references and related links.

73170.name: Shogun: Total War

videogamehonor.29660: 2001 D.I.C.E. Best Innovation of the Year Nominee (Computer)

73170.description:
[User Summary]:

Shogun: Total War is the first game in the Total War series. As a Daimyo (a Japanese noble warlord), your task is to unite Japan under your rule and be proclaimed Shogun (dictator, ruler).

The game is split in two parts, a turn-based strategic game where each player move armies on the map and conduct diplomacy, commerce and research, and real-time battles where opposing armies in the same province fight.

The game also includes several famous battles of medieval Japan, and a network multiplayer mode.

boardgamehonor.13894: 2011 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee

73171.description:
After 500 years, two factions emerge from their underground cities into a new world, an Earth reborn from nuclear disaster.

12 highly detailed miniatures represent the two factions which are:

NORAD: military in thinking and origins. Scientists, engineers, add to their strength.

SALEMITES: occultists working with cadavers, bringing the dead to life.

Soon after emerging, these two factions meet - and it is determined that they cannot live together in peace.

Earth Reborn offers nine scenarios that take you through missions of rescue, retrieval, and escort through areas of labs, mansions, towns, and more. Each scenario builds upon the rules of a new chapter: the game system is built like a tutorial. There are core rules to start the game, and each chapter offers 1-3 new rules along with a scenario that uses these new rules.

The game also contains the innovative S.A.G.S. (Scenario Auto Generating System), where 2-4 players can make their own maps and mission objectives for near infinite replayability!

Other features include:

A Tetris-like board construction using polyomino floor tiles.
An order tiles system to give commands to your miniatures.
Interrupt Duels with Bluff, betting command points to interrupt an enemy character and act during another player's turn.
The I.P.S. (Iconographic Phrasing System) that allows almost any effect to occur with icons, totally language independent.
Colored base arcs on miniatures to simplify Line of Sight, shooting, and close combat. It also multiplies characters’ variations and possibilities.
The Search rule, giving a visceral feeling to searching in rooms to find equipment.
A Mission Points track that also serves as a Morale Points track.
Radio Scrambling to mess with your opponents' orders.
73171.name: Earth Reborn

73172.name: Wend-loop
73172.description:
The meandering path game.

Wend-loop is a path building game for two or more players. Players place tiles to build paths, and move their pieces along paths, sometimes jumping onto another path. The object of the game is to score the most points by completing paths containing your piece.

Contents
4 Player pieces
A set of 35 Playing tiles

Wend tiles are square in shape, and have 2 path entry/exit points on each edge. They each have four path sections which go from one path entry/exit point to another. When placed side by side, the path sections from one tile join up with those on the adjacent tile, to create meandering paths. There are 35 Wend tiles in a set, which includes one copy of all possible different combinations of 4 path sections on a tile.

A single set of 35 Wend tiles is enough for a good game with 2-4 players. You can use extra sets of Wend tiles to accommodate more players or for a longer and more challenging game with a small number of players.

73175.name: Ape Escape

videogamehonor.31698: 1999 Game Critics Best Platformer of the Year Nominee

73175.description:
[From the bax of the box]

The first game designed solely for use with the analog controller, APE ESCAPE takes you on a crazy adventure through time and space to stop mokeys taking over the world.
Over 20 true 3D levels. Bonus mini games including Monkey Boxing and ski racing!
Each monkey has an individual name, personality and skill level that affect gameplay.
Training rooms and 3 bonus games. Loads of gadgets and tools to collect throughout the game, including a slingshot, monkey net, sky-flying propellor, radio controlled car and rowing boat.

73176.name: PSP

videogamehwversion.55149: Camouflage (Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker) PSP-3000

73176.description:
User Summary

The PlayStation Portable (PSP) is the first handheld game console made by Sony and is the predecessor to the PlayStation Vita. Development of the console was announced during E3 2003 and the system was released in Japan on December 12, 2004, in North America on March 24, 2005, and in the PAL region on September 1, 2005. A remodeled version of the PlayStation Portable that was both slimmer and lighter called the PSP-2000/Slim & Lite was released in early September 2007. This model was later replaced by the PSP-3000 which featured a new screen and an inbuilt microphone. In 2011 a budget model called the PSP-E1000 was released with several features removed.

It is the only handheld video game console to use Universal Media Disc (UMD) as its primary storage medium. It also features robust multi-media capabilities and connectivity with the PlayStation 2, PlayStation 3, other PlayStation Portables, and the internet.

73178.name: Klonoa: Door to Phantomile
73178.description:
[From the back of the box]

Join Klonoa on a journey through a magical world where dreams and reality merge. Uncover the mystery of the legendary Moon Pendant and save the singer Lephise from the evil clutches of the evil Ghadius in this imaginative, enthralling adventure.

73181.name: PSP Go
73181.description: The PSP Go is a big redesign of the original PSP. It looks completely different the the older models and doesn't support the old UMD - game/movie discs. Its screen is smaller, but has the same pixel resolution of 480x272.

73182.name: Front Mission 3
73182.description:
[User summary]

Continuing the Front Mission Saga this third installment provides over 150 hours of turn based strategy action centering around a wide variety of highly customisable Battle Mechs.

73183.name: Gamesman (Issue 1)
73183.description:
Contents:

•News: Stay Informed
•LRP-Labyrinthe Competition: Win! Win! Win! Armour and weapons provided by one of Britain's leading professional LRP groups.
•Scan-Multi-Media: Convention, Games Industry, Film and Video Features.
•Dialogue with Gary Gygax: Past, Present & future.
•LRP - LiveWire: Liz Graham presents the latest LRP news along with this month's special feature on Laser tagging and SF LRP
•LRP - Quasar Laser: Martin Devlin reports on the fast growing laser tag sport/games of Quasar Laser.
•TV- The Crystal maze: Before the flood of games, jigsaws and assorted paraphenalia hits the shops, Gamesman takes a look at the popular channel 4 TV seris that inpired them all..
•Computers Online: Rik Henderson's news, views and reviews from the world of computer gaming
•Game Reviews: This month games past and present
•Film- Who's Robin Who?: Legendary heroics as Gamesman looks at the Costner/Bergin epics on the screen and in prodcution.
•Miniatures -microcosm: Ralph Horsley's column eases the task of finding the right miniatures company for the games that you may have a particular interest in.
•Compendium. It came from cyberspace: Marcus L Rowland explores cyberspace and comes up with some interesting ideas and scenarios.
•Books First Impressions: Martin Tudor,co-editor of critical wave, takes a lok at current releases on the literary scene.
•PBM-Post Mortem: Nicky Palmer, editor of Flagship, starts his monthly PBM column with Thrills through the mail- while Tim Knight reviews Rampage Games' The keys of Medokh and previews Heropress
•PBM-HeroPress: Games Update for Heropress Players.
•Puzzles: Tantalising teasers for young and old alike, includes a competion for our younger readers.

73184.description:
Published in first issue of Dragon Hobby magazine.

The expansion provides new map with four scenarios and two new commander tokens (Thokoly and Mehmed whose statistics are changed as compared to Wiedeń 1683).

There are only minor changes in the rules mostly covering charges. The changes make the game more dynamic than original Wiedeń 1683.
73184.name: Parkany 1683

73185.name: Judge Dredd (1997)
73185.description:
[From the game box]

Take on the mean streets of Mega City 1 as Judge Dredd in a first person, hyper action blast fest.

Judge Dredd propels you through 4 stages containing a total of 14 thunderous levels. As Dredd you'll fight your way through tunnels, plazas, escalators, lift shafts and Mezzanine floors through a frenzy of explosive 1st person 3D action. Light gun compatible.

73187.name: Enemies of the Empire

rpg.4996: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)

73187.description:
Since its inception, the Emerald Empire of Rokugan has faced challenge after challenge. From demonic hordes from the Shadowlands, to internal threats and conspiracies, the life of the samurai is anything but peaceful.
Enemies of the Empire features an array of challenges for players, and opportunities for gamemasters and players alike to add new flavor and new dangers to their travels in the Emerald Empire.
Enemies of the Empire serves not only as the bestiary for Fourth Edition, but also features threats of a more human nature. Delve into the conspiracies of the Kolat, the tainted ravings of the Lost, and the silent terror of the Lying Darkness. Explore the hard lives of ronin, and the strange cultures of the Naga, Ratlings, and other non-human races. And if your heart is strong enough, face the secrets behind the oni, spirits, and the undead.
Inside this tome you will find:
• A look at the many varied threats facing the Emerald Empire, with depth and detail on each.
• In-depth studies of the Kolat and their conspiracies, the Lost and the madness that takes them, Bloodspeakers and their vile cultist ambitions, and more.
• The horrors of the Shadowlands, including oni, goblins, the undead, and many unnatural beings that defy classification.
• Player character rules for ronin, as well as naga, ratlings, kenku, and other races.

From publisher.

73188.name: Shootin' Baskets
73188.description: A dexterity game in the same vein as Mr. Mouth. A basketball backboard with baskets on both sides is placed in the middle of a turntable. While the backboard spins around, up to four players try to launch balls into the baskets using small catapults. The first player to get all six of their balls into the baskets is the winner.

73189.description:
The children's game Mauseschlau&Bärenstark: Weltreise features the lovable cartoon characters in a race around the world. The mouse and bear answer questions about geography, culture, flags, landmarks, and much more!

The whimsical spinner has two sides: one with pictures and another with text. The game is designed to be enjoyed by kids of all ages with different play levels.
73189.name: Mauseschlau&Bärenstark: Weltreise

73190.name: Disney Memorix
73190.description:
from the rule book

Contenent: 16 large cards; 16 small cards; 16counter;
1 playing piece; 1 die.

Object of the game:
Players need to find the hidden Disney friends and collect counters to win the game.

How to play:
Place the large cards with the illustrated side face up to form a square. Place the small cards so they are also face up in the middle of the square.
The first player start throwing the die and move the playing piece around the large card in a clockwise direction. The Disney character you land on indicate the small card you must turn over in the middle. This ends the turn.
When you land on a large card that has alredy had the matching small card turned face down, you have to remember where this card is and find it. If you find it, you may take a counter, the first player to collect 4 counter win.

73193.description:
From the back of the game box:

Calling all fearless photographers!
We are today heading for Oklahoma City where the first ever Tornado Spotting World Championships are about to begin. Extreme weather is expected, accompanied by even more extreme photographers. Speed, split-second timing, calculated risk-taking and outsmarting the competition are your tickets to victory!

Original version: Object of the game from the first page of rulebook:

The players compete for three rounds then see who, on average, has taken the best tornado photos. The higher the number of points from the photos, the better. The higher the number of card, the more dangerous the photographer's location depicted, so it's important to make the right decisions during the game. At the end of each round, the players determine their average score of the photos taken in their points pile using the averages table. Each round ends when the Game Over card is picked up. After the third round, each player's lowest average score of the three is selected and the player with the highest of these lowest scores is the winner.

Second Edition changes game as follows:

Players no more try to get highest average during three rounds. Instead, they try to get as much points as possible during each round and players can play any number of rounds as well. This makes averages table obsolete in second edition. Some card functions are also streamlined to make game play faster and more intuitive. Rules of the second edition are only in english and finnish.

The game box contains:

75 cards (21 different types of)
15 +1/-1 markers
1 two-sided score table
1 score pad (50 pages)
Includes German, French, English, Dutch, Swedish and Finnish rules.
73193.name: Tornado Alert!

73194.name: Itadaki Street DS
73194.description:
User Summary

A Monopoly-like board game of where you use roll and move techniques to purchase properties, where having more than one from a set increases the amount of rent than can be charged when another player lands on it. It features varied, moving boards and characters from the Mario and Dragon Quest universes.

73195.name: Robot Unicorn Attack
73195.description:
From iTunes page

The goal of Adult Swim's ROBOT UNICORN ATTACK is to gallop, leap and dash through the sky in pursuit of your dreams, all to the tune of "Always" by Erasure. (Unicorns are big Erasure fans, and robot unicorns are no different.) Once the magic of ROBOT UNCORN ATTACK takes hold of your heart, you'll never want it to let go. Share your high scores with your Facebook friends, and make your dreams come true!

73197.name: Angry Birds

videogamehonor.30276: 2011 D.I.C.E. Best Casual Game of the Year Winner

73197.description:
Taken from the Rovio website

"Lemme tell ya, these ain’t no ordinary finches we’re talkin’ about. These here are the Angry Birds, the ones that’s gonna kick you in the ‘nads. And they’re the ones on your side. They must be from Galapadapados, or sumptin’." - Col. Angus, Bird Expert

The survival of the Angry Birds is at stake. Dish out revenge on the green pigs who stole the Birds’ eggs. Use the unique destructive powers of the Angry Birds to lay waste to the pigs’ fortified castles.

Angry Birds features hours of gameplay, challenging physics-based castle demolition, and lots of replay value. Each of the 120 levels requires logic, skill, and brute force to crush the enemy.

Protect wildlife or play Angry Birds!

73198.name: Lost Halls of the Dwarven Kings
73198.description:
From the publisher's website:

High in the mountains, the old fortress had stood for centuries. Impregnable, unconquerable, no army could assail it, no enemy could breach it save one: nature itself. The Great Quake shattered the mountains, the fortress cracked and fell. Abandoned, forgotten, exposed to the elements it waits. Waits for those brave enough to dare enter it's darkened halls and claim the lost treasures within. No easy task to be sure, for the mountains are home to vicious wolves and nomadic tribes of frost goblins, even the elusive Yheti, to say nothing of the spirits of those lost to the Great Quake. In huddled corners and in whispered tones it is said that even greater evils dwell within the lost halls of the Dwarven Kings...

Lost Halls of the Dwarven Kings contains all of the following:


8 6"x6" floors in 1", 1.5" and gridless formats
4 6"x3" halls in 1", 1.5" and gridless formats
10 3"x3" small floors in 1", 1.5" and gridless formats
Uniqe and generic post anchors



Big arched wall
Forge room walls
Hallway arches
6 3" walls in plain and snow covered styles
4 6" walls in plain and snow covered styles
1", 1.5" and 2" walls in plain and snow covered styles
Long and short angled walls in plain and snow covered styles
6" and 3" double-height walls in plain and snow covered styles
6 post types
3 double-height post types



3" and 6" balconies with supports
3" and 6" railings
1", 1.5" and 3" stairs



Bridges
Pit traps
Forge props
Standees
2.5D Ice demon


And as always, Lost Halls of the Dwarven Kings comes with fully illustrated, easy to follow instructions.

73199.name: Moero! Nekketsu Rhythm Damashii: Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan 2
73199.description:
"Moero! Nekketsu Rhythm Damashii: Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan 2 (燃えろ！熱血リズム魂　押忍！闘え！応援団２, Moero! Nekketsu Rizumu-damashii Osu! Tatakae! Ōendan Tsū, lit. "Burn! Hot-Blooded Rhythm Spirit: Hey! Fight! Cheer Squad 2") is a rhythm video game developed by iNiS and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo DS handheld video game console. It is the third game to use its gameplay, and is the sequel to Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan while incorporating many of the improvements in gameplay made in Elite Beat Agents. The game has 4-player wireless play, supports the Nintendo DS Rumble Pak accessory, and was released in Japan on May 17, 2007."

Source: Wikipedia, "Moero!_Nekketsu_Rhythm_Damashii_Osu!_Tatakae!_Ouendan_2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

73203.name: Barney's Rainbow Egg Game

boardgameversion.43384: Parker Brothers "Barney's Great Adventure, The Movie" edition

73203.description:
This is a children's game based on the Barney's Great Adventure movie.

Players leave the barn with Twinken's Rainbow Egg and move along the track by matching colors. The kids have adventures as they visit the circus, watch a parade, etc. Cards instruct the children to find colors or play let's pretend.

Players collect star chips for following instructions correctly. The kid with the most score chips when the players reach the finish line is declared the winner.
Includes a colorful puzzle-cut board, a plastic Barney, the egg, star tokens, a spinner, cards, and the rules.

73204.description: Shed is a clever trick-taking game for 2-5 players that fully utilizes all of the unique characteristics of the Decktet Game System. Players start the game with a pool of tokens matching the Decktet’s suits and then they try to get rid of them through careful trick taking. The first player to shed all of his tokens is the winner.
73204.name: Shed

73205.name: Run Mousey Run

boardgameversion.43391: Marx Toys 'The Little Entertainers box' edition

73205.description:
Description from box:

The little mouse who's hungry for cheese
Must avoid the cat and the old lady's broom
Help him to escape through the mousehole with ease,
Or win all the cheese that's there in the room.

User Summary:
The mouse is pulled back and wound up, then released from the center circle. Where will he land? Will you win 1-4 pieces of cheese (get 8 on your cheese board and you win!) or will you get the broom or the cat? If the mouse gets out through the mouse hole past the cat you win automatically.

73206.name: Color-Coded
73206.description:
In this color decoding, star gathering, trick playing game you gotta be the first to match your various colored Star Cards with the Code dealt and use special PLAY cards, switch abilities and Black Wild cards to change the round in your favor. Obtain five wins and the game is yours!

Color-Coded is simple to learn! Each player is given a specific code of colored stars they need to match using the colored cards in their hand. Match the code and you move on to the next, match five and you win the game!

There are special cards to help tip the balance in your favor. Use the Black Wild Cards which can be used for any card in your code. PLAY cards grant abilities like switching, trading, and even destroying your other players hand and code! When nothing else can be done, you can at least tempt fate by using SWITCH, which forces all players to choose a card from their hands and pass it to their left, maybe the card you need is just around the corner?

The best part is no matter where you are in the game, additional people can join in the fun! Simply deal then a hand and give him a code. Who knows, the winner may have just arrived!


of Players: 2-6


Game Time: 45 min.

Includes:
* Star Cards Deck (80 cards)
* Code Cards Deck (40 cards)
* Color-Coded Rules Document

73207.description:
An extra large magazine/supplement to make up for the 'year without ASL' (1994), containing articles and scenarios. It came with an outer cardstock cover that had overlays for Deluxe ASL; however, these turned out to be printed at the wrong size


( from the Table of Contents:)

Airborne Samurai by Steven C. Swann
Annual Crossfire by Robert Banozic & Mark Nixon
Warriors All! by David Payne
The Chestnuts of Normandy by Jim Stahler
En Garde by Chuck Goetz
The Gentle Art of Routing by Steve Tinsley
The Scenarios of Normandy by Jim Stahler
Series Replay: Festung St. Edouard by Steve Peterson, Brian Youse & Chuck Goetz

Scenarios:
A68 Acts of Defiance
A69 Broich Bash
A70 Wintergewitter
A71 Patton's Prayers
A72 Italian Brothers
A73 Not Out of the Woods Yet
A74 Valhalla Bound
A75 Medal of Honor
A76 Night Drop
A77 Hide & Seek
A78 Prelude to Breakout
A79 Mike Red
A80 Commando Schenke
A81 They Fired on Odessa...
A82 Orange at Walawbum
A83 Last of Their Strength
A84 Endless Struggle
A85 Airborne Samurai
A86 Fighting Sparrow
A87 The Grand Canal
A88 Surprise Encounter
A89 First Day of Diadem
A90 Cutting Out a Strongpoint
DA13 The Mailed Fist
73207.name: ASL Annual '95

73210.description:
De Twaalfde Man is a simple roll-and-move game. It was given away at EMTÉ Supermarkets (The Netherlands) for the 2010 World Cup.

The game recuires 1 die and a miniature from 'Het Oranje Legioen' per player. 'Het Oranje Legioen' are small, orange supporters you can collect at the supermarket.

The board is a soccerpitch on which players move their pawn. On different fields a special situation happens - always with a soccer background: a yellow card, an off-side, free kick, etc. The winner is the one who - on the last field - kicks the ball in the right corner (by throwing the die).
73210.name: De Twaalfde Man

73211.name: MMOSBG
73211.description:
From the Publisher's Website

MMOSBG is an online board game. Games typically last about a week and consist of 10 - 100 players. Moves are made by clicking on open white space and available moves accumulate hourly. You can invade other players' territory by clicking adjacent squares. Occupied squares can randomly convert to available whitespace and are refered to as taxholes.

MMOSBG is a persisent online board game that is played over the course of several days against other players around the world. Persistent means the game continues while you are away. Generally one can remain competitive by playing for 5 minutes at a time, a couple times a day. Please choose a board and register for free. You can be playing within the next minute. Have fun.

73212.name: Infiltrator
73212.description:
User summary, (details from Wikipedia):

Infiltrator is a rather unique game from 1986 developped for several 8-bit systems. The player takes the role of James "Jimbo" McGibbits, whose mission is to first fly a helicopter to an enemy base, and proceed to infiltrate the base, searching the rooms and drawers for security keys that unlock the doors that block the way to the mission objective.

During the flights to the mission objective, he is interrogated by other aircraft trying to determine if he's friend or foe. A wrong reply causes the enemy to attack, and James then have to engage in air-to-air combat.

James has no weapons for the infiltration missions, but carries false papers that may fool guards if they come close and ask for identification. James also has a limited supply of sleeping spray and gas grenades to knock out guards. If a guard asks for identification and James runs away, the alarm goes, the mission has failed and James need to return to his helicopter to fly home, unless he can shut the alarm off. On certain levels, James can find a janitor dress, which will allow him to sneak into places and fiddle around without the guards getting suspicious.

The game consists of three missions to complete, three flights and three infiltrations. The combination of two game modes and the sneaking and infiltration aspect makes Infiltrator a game far before its time.

Source: Wikipedia, "Infiltrator," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

73213.name: Into the Armory
73213.description:
From the publisher:

Into the Armory: The Complete Guide to Weapons, Armor, and Equipment

This Sourcebook for the 3.5 OGL and the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game contains cartloads of new weapons, armor, and other equipment for DMs and PCs. In addition to these tools and treasures any adventurer would kill to have, this book also contains rules for Quasi-Magical items, a new class of semi-magical utility designed to both provide useful tricks for clever players, and to provide fun and exciting adventures.
